intro: Baccaurea latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf baccaurea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces edible, fleshy berries that are often consumed raw or used in local cuisines. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is cultivated in some regions for both aesthetic and culinary purposes.
